subject: RE: [junit] Can I create a dynamic JUnit ?  (in Cactus Framework)
msgSnippet: ... State between method invocations isn t the problem here. What Donny wrote about sounds a lot like the Parameterized TestCase pattern, that is a valid Junit
messageBody:
>> When I debug my code, I saw that JUnit calls my constructor,
>> and added the object into the suite. However, when it runs
>> the test case, it try to re-create the object again by
>> calling generic constructor with no-args or one arguments.
>
> This is by design in JUnit: your test objects are
> reinstantiated from scratch before every test method, which
> makes it hard to maintain state between method invocations.

State between method invocations isn't the problem here.

What Donny wrote about sounds a lot like the Parameterized TestCase pattern,
that is a valid Junit pattern and should just work fine.

Cheers, Ilja
